channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Flash Floods Sweep Part of Long Island
item.description: Floods swept Long Island early Monday, briefly closing highways. The same storm system dumped as much as 10 inches of rain on Connecticut a day earlier.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Blinken Says Talks Are ‘Maybe the Last’ Chance for Gaza Cease-Fire
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Israel. Hamas and Islamic Jihad claimed responsibility for a suicide blast in Tel Aviv that injured one person.

item.title: Billionaire Carl Icahn and company fined $2 million over secret personal loans secured with company stock
item.description: Between 2018 and the present, Icahn pledged approximately as much as 82% of Icahn Enterprises' outstanding securities as collateral to secure personal loans.

item.title: Woman Who Accused Eric Adams of Assault Wrote About It Years Ago
item.description: A former Transit Police Department colleague of the mayor said she told seven people years ago that he had sexually assaulted her in 1993, according to new court filings.

item.title: The Mennonites Making the Amazon Their Home
item.description: Groups of Mennonites, seeking inexpensive land far from modern life, are carving out new colonies in the Amazon. They are also raising fears that they are adding to the deforestation of the vital jungle.

item.title: Here’s how to find out if your Social Security number was included in last week’s massive data breach
Prosecutors in Trump Hush-Money Trial Leave Decision on Sentencing to Judge
item.description: Lawyers for Donald J. Trump had asked to move his sentencing in Manhattan on 34 felony counts to after the election. In a letter, prosecutors disputed many of their arguments.

item.title: Tech Entrepreneur Mike Lynch Among 6 Missing After Yacht Sinks Off Sicily
item.description: Fifteen other people were rescued after the vessel went down in a storm. Expert divers were called in to carry out search operations in the deep water. A British software mogul was among the missing.

item.title: How the internet’s charm can disrupt our kids’ perceptions
item.description: As teens immerse themselves online more and more, it can create a desire to compare their own lives, leading to feelings of inadequacy or discontent.

item.title: Kamala Harris Takes Her First Big Risk
item.description: A proposal on “price gouging” is stirring up quite a debate.

item.title: Ukraine Attacks Bridges in Russia’s Kursk Region, Aiming to Encircle Troops
item.description: The attacks look to destroy or damage crossings over a river in the Kursk region that are Russian forces’ only routes for resupply or retreat, military analysts say.

item.title: A billionaire is about to make the first spacewalk by a private citizen
item.description: Shift4 founder will soar higher than anyone since the 1970s.

item.title: The Mennonites Making the Amazon Their Home
item.description: Groups of Mennonites, seeking inexpensive land far from modern life, are carving out new colonies in the Amazon. They are also raising fears that they are adding to the deforestation of the vital jungle.

item.title: Blinken Travels to Israel Amid Push for Gaza Cease-Fire
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu cautioned that the negotiations were “very complex,” as the secretary of state flew to Israel to try to clinch a deal.

item.title: COVID guidelines have changed. Here’s when a sick kid can return to school
item.description: As schools move on from COVID-19, health experts and school districts are changing guidelines for when to keep kids home.
